S.FORM: aikibulrunga nai, samudane ki takibulrubulruwa ku singsi, ku pangcang amiya ikai：“ idiya! sukuba!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: la akwadrau nai singsi. sabau miya.
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: sa kibulru nai, ku singsi wabulru naiya ahakai ku kacalrilrisiyana wasipi.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Rukai language of numbers.

S.FORM: twapapalra nai silrigu, la bulru naiya ahasenai wasipi.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: makalra ku kibulru li si thingale ku kacalrilrisiyana.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Rukai languages.

S.FORM: mwagakua ku luadhane, kyabulruwa ku ku kacalrilrisiyana luadhane, aipakilalra ku ki ina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Rukai language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ku nagane li ki sya Muakai.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Muakai。
My name is Muakai.

S.FORM: ku nagane ki ama sya Legeai.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Legeai。
My dad’s name is Legeai.

S.FORM: ku nagane ki ina sya Alaelrepe.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Alaelrepe。
My mother’s name is Alaelrepe.

S.FORM: tahamangealanga ku caili li.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: tangea ku kake ka sauwalai, sya Sakinu. tahamangealanga si ea ku caili ini.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Sakinu，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Sakinu, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: mahahamau ku gaku nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: kunaku si kake tahamadalame nai senai.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: madalama ku lwangui, lu taibalribalriva, mahedele nai ka wacekecekele lwangui.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: madalama ku kisudalru ku bauwa ka talrailragi, wadulru madu taelre senai si langui.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: lavavalaka ku ka Ngudradrekai.
S.TRANSL: 我是魯凱族的小孩。
I am an Ngudradrekai child.

S.FORM: ku daane nai yakai Labuwa.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在大武霧台鄉。
Our family lives in Labuwa.

S.FORM: kunai ka wacekecekele talrima nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatulru nai ka lamatakataka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: taelrea ku ki ama, ina, kake ka sauwalai si kake ka ababai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ku ama maelrenge, ku ama kisace.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: ku ina kuladha, ku ina kwisang.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: lu ikai tauwana ku ama ahakai ku kacalrilrisiyana kauhiva naiya.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Rukai language with us at home.

S.FORM: lu taibalribalriva ki kaladrangedranga mwabalriyu nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: kunaku si lakake mahedele nai malra ku takuhauhu.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: madalama ku ki wacekecekele li.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: kaiasaa mahedela ku ki ina avaevaehe.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: sa avaiya waledra subelebelenge, kadruwa ka makecelre kadruwa ka wadrangedrange, mangangehece ku saseveha.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: yakai nai ki ububula kwanekane ku mingpau, ku vai pasaelre ki kinaumasane nai pakaculu.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: sa angyayaubu, kai subelebelenge madiheele.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: la kitubulruwa ku ki ina, ani kadiheele subelebelenge?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: laiya ikai ku ina, tali aikela ku sedreke.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: sa amaungu kadruwa ku emeeme subelebelenge, ngyabuale ku tahiyau.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: lai ubalryunga nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: ikai kaelrelrea, la kitubiya ku ki tahiyau.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: anatuma lakai kela ku sedreke, apya kivaevangeanana ku.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: ku gaku li yathili ki dane nai, luadhana wadadavaca ku mugaku, la dadavace mutauwana.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: mwatiki ku gaku nai, tabekele ku situ, kunai mathingathingale nai makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: sana alavavalake yahubu ikai talrabwabwala, taelre ngimalri, taelre kalaelange.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: ku singsi nai taelre naiya kivaevange, myaki nai wacekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: luadhana waswape nai, aipakabula nai suape ki takibulrubulruwane nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: yakai ku waselredre ki lribange, yakai ku waswape.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: waswape nai sana akalyupa, mapalribilribulu nai, ku gaku nai mabula luadhana.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: kudhaa, mwa cekela ku lrikape ki umu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: maulainga nai kai macaceele, mabahengehengana ku iniya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: sa ceele nakuwa ku umu, wapakane nakuwa ku swika, paungulu nakuwa ku uciya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: malimeme ku lredreke ki umu ku swika, patengatenga ka malimeme.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: miyalri madalama ku ku uciya ki umu, miyalri kalimeme.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: sa mulringedele, taelrea ku ki kaingu waaga ku kudrali.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: makalra ku aga ki kaingu, yakai ku kaange, tahukuku, tahamunage, laikai ku dingidingi.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: sa makakane nai, la uwa nai lalacenga kilacenge.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: ku kaingu amalra ku makalra ku tai si kucai bwaai pailuku nakuwa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: kyapusauwa ku liniya, si nau kelanga lubibilrili mya liniya.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: kaiasaa, ku singsi aiiluku naiya mwaki tasyavavavaa ki udryudripi, yahubu nai ikai saulatadra lwangai ku kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: sa mudaanenga nai, ku singsi amiyaikai, kwani cucubungu ladhadhame, talilrilrikudru lalawlai, ngikakamaniya syavava.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mwakuludra ku ki alawlai, lakuni ku kalrase li mwa ceele.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: wacela ku ku makalra ku adhadhame, yabelenge ki angatu ngipapapalai, la ceela ku ku luu ku waapece ibahungulu ki angatu.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: ikai ki tasyavavavaa ki udryudripi, yakai ku zuu, higi, si lrikulau, kadruwana ka waceele ikai laudryudripi kai, kyahagadha ku sa ceela ku kaiasaa.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: makalra ku sasingi li, aipacela ku ki ama si ina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: lubibilrili aikahedela ku ki ama si ina kela.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: kai taibalribalriva kai, kunaku si kake amwa nai Taitu lrikape ki agi ki ama.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: twalai nai Taihuku ngukai ki kisa muTaitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: sa kela nai Taitu, ku agi ki ama waungting ki didyusa kidresenge naiya.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: adethe tisaba ku daane ki agi ki ama, padalru nai sikela.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: adethe ki agi ki ama ku mwaadrau ka tapagwagwaguwa, mahedele nai ngutukutuku mwa.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ikai tapagwagwaguwa, ku agi ki ama wailuku naiya pwakane ki kiyu si higi.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: sa amaungu, mahedele nai mumaci kwane ku aga.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: makalra ku didyusa maci, lakuni ku ngukai nai ki utubai.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: sa aidavacenga nai, sika kyakupa ku utubai, langukainga nai ki base dwavace.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: syaulringa nai muTaihuku, kyadringadhangaini ku agi ki ama ku utubai ini.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: saalavavala ku, ku daane nai yakai Labuwa, sa mugakungana ku, la talela nai papiya Akau, ikai paihange cekecekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在大武霧台鄉，上學以後，就搬到了屏東，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Labuwa. After I started school, we moved to Pingtung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: sa kadrawngana ku, lai kibulruwa ku ku pathahukai ki kakuakudha ki kacalrisiya, thingalenga ku taikalra makaelaela ku kakuakudha ikaikai Taiwang.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: lakuni, ikai taibalribalriva ki kaladrangedranga, kunaku si kake la mucekele nai kitububulru ki tahudrawdrange, api thingale ku kakuakudhane nai ka Ngudradrekai.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: kaivai tahudrawdrange tahamavalrulunga ku caili ini, ai luceela myaki yacengecenge.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: kyatubulruwa ku iniya ku thingale ini ku vaga, lu ngudradreadrekadha macalrusi, miyalri thingale ku Dridripungana, paihaihangana si amilryalrikana.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的魯凱語說得很流利，也會說日本話、閩南語和英語。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Rukai, as well as Japanese, Hokkien and English.

S.FORM: sa kitubulrungana ku iniya wathingala ku, sika kyabulru saalavavalake ku Dridripungana, ku tauwane ini Amilrika, laikai ki tatwatwatumanane ini kisudalru ku takalra ku paihange, lakuni thingale ku taikalra ka vaga.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是美國人，而他工作上認識許多漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an American, and he knows many Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: sa kitububulru nai iniya, matikai ku taikalra ku lrigila lu alupu kuigayga.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: eene kadruwaka makathingale demedeme, ai ahakai nai ku suci tukacudu, lai makadulrunga nai kilalra tupudriyadringai.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: saalavavalaka ku kadruwa ka wathingale ikai kakuakudhane nai, matininu ku takakacalrisiyanane li.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: sa haukakalra ku thingale li, haungyathathingala ku lu amani madu ku Ngudradrekai, amani ku mwakalrivili, amani ku adulruwane madu ngidradraha.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為魯凱族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Rukai is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: kaingyaiyaubu, aikela ku agili.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: kunaku si kaingu amwa nai maci lwangai ku tahukuku, padulru ku malimeme ka kwaubu pwakane ki agili.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: sa lribate nai ki talacenga, makalra ku tawnyalralra ka lacenge.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: walangai nai ku kungsingcai, tuba si daikungu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: ku yathili ki syubai ki madru ka tauki laiyaikai, malimeme kaivai pangudrale li si mumu, lwangadha ngubekele.
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: la langai nai ku pangudrale si mumu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: sa lribate nai ki tabutula, kudra tauki laiyaikai ailangai su ku manema? kaivai tahukuku kaiasaa maadrau si kahicuhu tulru ka idai ku ea.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: kau kaingu makucingalre laiya, la kitubulru ki tauki luaimaka tupadulru ku bekela.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: kwani tauki latubalre mapadulrunga, kadruwaka aimaka kivalanga.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kudra yathili ka tauki laiyaikai nyama lwangadha ikai kaange li, madrau si lakapadulru.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: sabilrila walangai nai ku tahukuku si kaange mutauwana waga pasiete ki cukui.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: maulai nai mukalava si kadradrimitinga.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: ku agili la pangudingva myaikai twahanau patuicilri paibalriyu naiya, lu adrihainga ki bibilrili aimaka mubalriva ku.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: kau kaingu amiyaikai kaiwaagangana ku tuthathathaa, dwaula nikela makanaelre kwane!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: ladawdaulu nai ki lahetesa talrailragi, ku wakela kalringulu kisupilri ikaivai makaelaelaela ka kwaubu.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: yakai ku sapasyasilange li ku sya Usau, wasavidhi kahimuhu iluku ku lamanemane ini.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Usau，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Usau, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: lu kibulrubulru, kyasalru ki sapasyasilange ini ku cingpi, sasupisupilra si cyumingi.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: ngivale, ngipusale, ngitulrulu, pakyasalruana iniya makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ai, yakai ku ngyalisiya ku kakudhane ini, wasavidhi kisalru sikai saulryulri.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: sabilrilanenga kadruwa ka apya pakisalru iniya makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: yakai saavaivai, kunai makanaelre mahedela nai kivaevange.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ikai kaelrelrea, kau Usau apya mubingziyunga, ai, mahimuhu iluku ku wisengce.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Usau想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: la kisalru ki sapasyasilange ini, ai amiya ikai tubalre iniya, makanaelre miyalriya ku kadruwa ka wailuku.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: kau Usau la tubi ki samama. la kalisi myaikai, asi ani kai pakisalru nakuwa makanaelre!
S.TRANSL: Usau急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Usau burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: ku sapasyasilange lapelaela iniya, amanisa kaisu ngiyaililuku, lu pakisalru musuwa ku lamanema, lakai su saulryulri!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: sa mugaku laadhana, ngwalalakese mugaku kau Usau, la saulri demedeme idra kisalru ini ki sapasyasilange ini.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Usau很早就到學校了，Usau把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Usau arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: sabau laiya kau Usau ki sapasyasilange ini, laiya ikai lu bibilrili aingiyailukungana ku, la kyaseasene ki sapasyasilange ku tapakisalruwa iniya ku lamanema.
S.TRANSL: Usau向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Usau apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: ku ama taha alwalupu ikai ki cekele nai.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: sa alruladha ku, ku ama si agiini wadavace lu amaungu, iluku ku lrabu si kwange.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: lu kaledra, la kainganai iluku ku pana lini.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: yakailu ababui, yakailu alrava, yakailu apadamatha.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: yakai sakakela ki cekele pavalavala ku pana, pakisupilri ki kinauwacekela.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: luiya makavaladha ku ki ama, api tupalra walupu.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ku ama laiya ikai, lu kadraunga su nau iluku musuwa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: ku sauwalai ki cekele yakailu ahakai ku kateme pwana, wadahepe ku nipalreea si taenge tukulru.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: ku ama malrigili ahakai ku tukulru, amiyaikai sahakaiya pwalra ki padamatha, waceele madu ku dalrane ki udryudripi, pyakai madu ki tangukakaiyane lini putukulru.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ngwalai ku asaha tupalra ki tahudrawdrange walupu, kyacakuwana ku luadhane dwahepe ku tukulru, aipadalrunga laipana kai tukulru li.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: sa ceele ku ama amiyaikai nakuwa lubibilrili aitaha amani su ku mahakace ka tahaalupu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: kaiasaa madrawngana ku, waangeala ku ki buu si lraili li, tupalra ki ama walupu.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: la pakisupilri ki kinauwacekela ku pana li.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: ku ama amiyaikai, aikiyaseasene ta ki lacucungulane ta ku sasubulrubulruwa mitaa, la patahumaha ku makalra ku pana.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: kay myalrealre ngyalalrangaku mugaku.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: samugakuwaku, mahimuhaku kai iluku ku kabange.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: kadruwa ka wailuku sanaamanema.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: sakibulrubulrunai, taelreaku ki hedelaneli ceele ku hungu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: sasikinginai, ku hedelaneli pakisalru nakuwa ku cingpi si sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: ku singsi amiyaikai nakuwa, lubibilrili sahangidrakaala
S.TRANSL: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
kai ngilalralalrangenga!""

S.FORM: ku talragili sya Sula, miyalri ka lalake ki Ngudradrekai.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Sula，他也是魯凱族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Sula, and he is also an Rukai child.

S.FORM: taelrenai ikai ki cekelenai Labuwa kibulrubulru.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在大武部落讀書。
We study together in the Labuwa tribe.

S.FORM: tataelreanenai kilalalra ki mahudrange lu tumaulai, taha malrigilinai Ngudradreadrekadha.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說魯凱語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Rukai proficiently.

S.FORM: maelrengaku si kabitulru, kau Sula edreka si kahilai.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Sula很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Sula is short and thin.

S.FORM: kau Sula pahahakaca, madalame makanaelre iniya.
S.TRANSL: Sula很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Sula is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: kayasaa ungdukai ki swa gaku, kay swa gaku pyaiya ku taikalra ku amakalrwalrumala.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: yakai ku mabilibilibili, watetehe ku malri, lrabuwale, udulri si walraili.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: kyapaelreaku ki lrabuwale.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: salrabwabuwalaku, mwalrevesaku, kay paculruli twaehaehai.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ai ngyadrakalaku, pacungulu papucucubungu lrwabuwale.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: sakelaku ki sakaamudu kudra laumase kyahahagai makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: eene kadruwa ka amalra ku icibange, ai kyahahagadhaku, asiluiyaa twalrepengaku ikay kikalrumaleli.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: kudhaa kunaku si ama walrikapenai ki agiini.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: ku agi ki ama madula ku drapaleini.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: peaelaela naiya, ku cavalriya ki daane mabulrutu.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: sa tupudringadringai ki cavalriya, twalai cavalriya mucilri.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: ku ama wailuku ku beate ki lwange si sabiki bwai ki agiini.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: kunaku si agi ki ama yakainai daane kalaelaelange, peaelaela nakuwa ku makalra ku maulai.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: sa aidavacenai, ku agi ki ama waseba nakuwa madraungasu miya, lahau kathahihi ngisauwalai.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: amiyaku ikai, lu mudringainga ku drapaleini, aikelananaku liniyana kivaevange.
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: ikay ki 2022 ka caili, kay swasihu yahubu mapelaela pathahukai ikay nibungsiyu ki kacalrisiya ku adulruwa drepele ahakai ku kacalrilrisiyana pwacase ku nagane.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kiatubulruwaku ku maulainga papiya ki sihu kihahibici ku akipalrainga drepele ahakai ku kacalrilrisiyana pwacase pikai ki nibungsiyu ka yacengecenge ka sya Cemelresai.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Cemelresai。
I interviewed Cemelresai, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: mapapalrainginai lu ataibalriva aiuwaku liniyana kitububulru iniya.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ikay ki takitububulruwaneli, papiya nakuwa ngipapelaela ku tatualadha ku naganeini, la iluku nakuwa pathingale ki wacekecekeleini, si cekeleini.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kyatubulruwaku iniya asu kakeecengenga naubalrithilringa ki nagane miya, kay sakukakudhaa pwacase ki nagane malisi?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: amiyaikai nakuwa, asiluiyaa lu ahakai ku ciniyukukana pwacase kadruwa ka aimaka pacengecenge patakela ku pathaheva ki naganeini, ku druma ku umase yakaiyana ku 「車先生」 amiya, si mutaluvaivainga ku makalra ku matiyalrupi matipulrivale.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Che Xian Sheng

S.FORM: kau Cemelresai amiyaikai, ku nyahakaiya ku kacalrilrisiyana pwacase ka nagane amani ku patengatenga ka naganenai. kay naganeli sapatuthingala ku takasumanemananenai, cucungulanenai, takaumawmasanenai, anatuma lahau takalra ku myanakuwa ka kacalrisiya la palraingi kyumau pasiyulri ku lanaganelini.
S.TRANSL: our family
Cemelresai said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: kudhaa twapalraku ki kaingu mumaci tusyubai, ku kaingu wailuku ku makalra ku ngilralredrekeini ka lacenge, lapiya twakanea ku kacalrilrisiyana ka lakanea bwai ki umase.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: madalame makanaelre ikay syubai ki kaingu, ku tavangulu si cemeameha takalra ku walangai, takalra ku umase ku wakela palalava ku tudamaiini.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和山當歸很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and Chinese Angelica, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: ku againi ku mawngu si duhai malimeme tuhamuhu, laahakai ku bulabulai si makau cehebe ku beate, ku tasangusadha wathehepe pakainganai ku takalra ku badhabadha, wakela ikay syubainai siyugu makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: lu agaga kau kaingu, yathilaku dwaudaulu ku badhabadha, yathilaku walealeale, kay lalacenge ngilralredrekenai, kadruwa ku sababuu, nyama lrwabwala lwangai.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, “The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!”

S.FORM: ku kilangainai ku lamanema padalru si kalrepenge, kau kaingu amiyaikai, amanisa ikaisu palribulu lakuni.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”

S.FORM: kay takakadra kay, makalra ku kibulruli pathahukai ikay kacalrilrisiyana ka lawacebecebe si lakanea ka thingala, la kipabalra ku sakwalriyalri lu tusyubadha.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: luceelaku ki kaingu ku hangehanganeini kay pathahwakai ki taleke ki kacalrisiya, ngyadradrahanaku si ikai ku lrigu.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
